main.name: Muhammad Farooq
main.occupation: Student at University of Toronto @ Scarborough
main.description: I hope to use my skills and experience to build reliable and robust software for the betterment of mankind
main.bio: I am a 4th year student studying Computer Science at the University of Toronto. Most recently, I have worked as both a DevOps engineer and Applications Developer through internships and am currently finishing my final semester of university with the aim to graduate in summer 2020. In this final semester, I am working on several different projects to further hone my skills.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to reach out to me by email, call, or text.

resume.skillmessage: I am proud to say I have built a plethora of skills throughout my internships, my education and through my own personal learning,

work.title: DevOps Intern
description: Improved Developer/QA self sufficiency through development of web app (Ruby, Java, Angular) to provide team with access to automation for day-to-day functions
Increased Developer/QA productivity through development of DevOps Slack Bot (Nodejs) by building a CLI for automation of various tasks
Reduced failures and increased visibility in TeamCity CI pipeline through implementation of logging solution using the ELK stack
Maintained uptime of QA environments through creation, monitoring, and maintenance of web, database, and service servers using Chef and Sensu

work.title: Applications Development and Services
description: Designed a full Proof-of-Concept for integrating the SonarQube tool for code quality analysis into existing deployment pipeline
Developed a Java Application which automated the creation of dashboards illustrating the code quality of the engineering team
Presented key code quality metrics to directors and managers, convincing the team to invest in a code analysis tool

projects.title: TweetShow
projects.category: An in-depth twitter sentiment, emotion, and difficulty analysis tool

projects.title: PlanitApp
projects.category: An app created for my Software Engineering course, not my original idea. Allows users to plan trips using their location, budget, and personal preferances.

projects.title: Simple Cricket Score Tracker
projects.category: Built and deployed a mobile application on the Google Play Store which allows users to keep track of cricket scores including runs, wickets, overs, No Balls, Wide Balls, etc.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
